SEARCH
Package ca.sfu.cmpt213

Class Registry

java.lang.Object
ca.sfu.cmpt213.Registry
public class Registry extends Object
Registry class has two member variables - registeredBikes and an arrayList named list. registeredBike is used to give every bike a unique ID and also keeps into account the total number of bikes ever registered.

printHeading is a static function used to print headings with stars.

displayMainMenu is a static method and is called using the name of the class in main program.

displayBikes is a non-static method and is used to display the bikes in the ArrayList 'list' with indentation using string formatting

addNewBike is a non-static method that takes the Scanner sc as an argument and constructs a new bike using the non default constructor and it then adds the bike in the list.

displayAllBikesToString is a non-static method used to print all the bikes in the arrayList, the override function toString present in Bike class is used.

deleteBike is a non-static method that deletes a bike from the arrayList.It first displays all the bikes using displayBikes and then validates the bikeID provided by calling validateInt. If the user enters a string, we get a InputMismatchException which is handled by validateInt. If the user enters an integer, it is accepted by validateInt and then inside deleteBike , it is checked whether a bike exists with that bikeID.If there exists, the bike is deleted else if it does not exist, the deleteBike is called again recursively. Empty string input is also handled by this program.

alterBike is a non-static method that first lists all the bike using displayBikes and then prompts the user to choose a bike by entering the bikeID. I then validate my bikeID by calling validateInt. If i get a valid integer, then I search for the bikeID in the arrayList. If i find the bikeID, i ask for the attribute to change if i get a valid attribute, i call the setter of the respective attribute and the bike is altered. * if i don't get the bikeID, I first print all the bikes using displayAllBikes and then again ask for the bikeID. Empty string input is also handled by this program.

getNumberOfBikes is a non-static method that displays the total number of bikes using the .size() function of arrayList
